<!-- ABOUT THE PROJECT -->
## About The Project

As a neophyte climber who discovered this sport at the same time as my buddies, it always felt weird giving and receiving advices during my sessions.  
As an introvert, it also feels difficult starting conversations with more experienced climbers.  
As an engineer, it felt natural to have the solution to all these problems in my pocket.

Climbing Muse is a prime companion for people who seek general advices, want to actively analyse their sessions to correct posture mistakes, inefficiencies, or maybe learn from the bests.

This app provides a wide range of machine-assisted analysis to give as many data to work with. Use your camera, your recorded attempts, or pro athletes training sessions and get the best out of it.

<p align="right">(<a href="#readme-top">back to top</a>)</p>

<!-- GETTING STARTED -->
## Getting Started

This app requires at minimum Android 8.0 (Oreo, code O), but targets Android 12 (Snow Cone, code S_V2).  
Likewise, it uses Java 8 to compile.

### Manual build - Prerequisites

Build using Android Studio + Gradle
* Install [Android Studio][Android-studio-url]
* Install a Java Development Kit
* Download the source code or clone the repo: either the [nightly build][nightly-build], or the [latest stable][latest-stable-build]. Keep in mind nightly build can be unstable. 
  ```sh
  git clone https://github.com/EspylArva/climbing-muse-kotlin.git
  ```
* Open the project using Android Studio, and build an APK file

### Installation

1. Get the APK file on your Android device, by building it manually, or heading to the ['Release'][release-url] section
2. Locate and open the APK file
3. Give permission to install the APK. You might need to allow installation from unknown sources. If so, it is recommended to disable installation from unknown sources after you completed the installation of this application for safety measures.

<p align="right">(<a href="#readme-top">back to top</a>)</p>

<!-- ROADMAP -->
## Roadmap

- [ ] More documentation
- [ ] Refining existing features, in particular settings
- [ ] Capture camera and save folder
- [ ] Read and analyse files (movies and photos) from device storage
  - [ ] Refine video player (frame-per-frame)
  - [ ] Device explorer, with categorisation and filtering of files
  - [ ] Side-by-side and/or Superposition comparison tool

See the [open issues](https://github.com/EspylArva/climbing-muse-kotlin/issues) for a full list of proposed features (and known issues).

<p align="right">(<a href="#readme-top">back to top</a>)</p>



<!-- CONTRIBUTING -->
## Contributing

Contributions are what make the open source community such an amazing place to learn, inspire, and create. Any contributions you make are **greatly appreciated**.

For now, I am the only contributor to this project. I might open this to the public and add contributors in the future. If you're interested, feel free to open an issue, so I get a notification!

If you have a suggestion that would make this better, please fork the repo and create a pull request. You can also simply open an issue with the tag "enhancement".
1. Fork the Project
2. Create your Feature Branch (`git checkout -b feature/AmazingFeature`)
3. Commit your Changes (`git commit -m 'Add some AmazingFeature'`)
4. Push to the Branch (`git push origin feature/AmazingFeature`)
5. Open a Pull Request

Don't forget to give the project a star! Thanks again!
<!--


-->
